knowledge.response: Base is Ethereum's Layer 2 (L2) blockchain solution built by Coinbase. It's designed to provide a secure, low-cost, and developer-friendly environment for building decentralized applications. Base uses optimistic rollup technology to bundle transactions off the main Ethereum chain, resulting in significantly lower gas fees (typically under $0.01) while maintaining Ethereum-level security.

Gas fees on Base Network are significantly lower than Ethereum mainnet. Average transaction costs on Base are typically $0.001 - $0.01, compared to Ethereum's $5-$50+ during peak times. This makes Base ideal for frequent transactions, NFT minting, and DeFi activities without worrying about high costs.

Popular DeFi protocols on Base include:

‚Ä¢ Uniswap V3 (decentralized exchange)
‚Ä¢ Curve Finance (stablecoin swaps)
‚Ä¢ Aave (lending protocol)
‚Ä¢ Compound (money markets)
‚Ä¢ BaseSwap (native DEX)
‚Ä¢ Moonwell (lending & borrowing)
‚Ä¢ Seamless Protocol (DeFi suite)

The ecosystem is growing rapidly with new protocols launching weekly.

To bridge assets to Base Network:

1. Visit the official Base Bridge: bridge.base.org
2. Connect your wallet (MetaMask/Coinbase Wallet)
3. Select source chain (Ethereum) and destination (Base)
4. Enter amount to bridge
5. Approve transaction and confirm
6. Wait 1-2 minutes for completion

Alternative bridges: Hop Protocol, Across Protocol, Stargate Finance.

Note: Always verify you're on the official bridge URL to avoid scams!
